name: Street Corn Bowls w/ Mexican Rice (Chicken or Beef)
description: Grilled chicken or seasoned ground beef served over Mexican rice with a creamy street corn mixture and charred jalapeños.

ingredients.name: Mexican Seasoning
ingredients.notes: Blend: 1/4 tsp chili powder, 1/8 tsp cumin, 1/8 tsp garlic powder, 1/8 tsp onion powder, pinch of paprika

ingredients.name: Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breast or Thigh

instructions: Prepare Protein Marinade: Choose Chicken or Beef. In a bowl, mix the corresponding ingredients listed under Protein Options (Olive Oil, Lime Juice, Chili Powder, Cumin, Smoked Paprika, Garlic Powder, Onion Powder).
Marinate Protein: Add chosen protein (6 oz chicken or 6 oz ground beef per serving) to the marinade. Season with salt and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes (or up to 4 hours refrigerated).
Cook Protein: If using chicken, grill or pan-sear until internal temp reaches 165°F (75°C). If using ground beef, cook in a skillet until fully browned, drain excess fat.

Prepare Mexican Rice: In a small pan, heat 0.5 tsp vegetable oil over medium heat. Add 0.25 cup dry white rice and brown for ~2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add 0.75 cup water, 1.25 tbsp tomato sauce, and 0.75 tsp Mexican seasoning (blend: 1/4 tsp chili powder, 1/8 tsp cumin, 1/8 tsp garlic powder, 1/8 tsp onion powder, pinch of paprika). Stir, cover, and cook on high heat for 10 minutes. Turn off heat, keep covered on burner for 5 minutes, then remove from heat and let sit covered for 10 minutes.
Prepare Street Corn: Heat corn kernels (0.75 cup per serving). In a bowl, mix the warm corn with mayonnaise (0.75 tsp), sour cream (0.75 tsp), lime juice (0.375 tsp), and chili powder (0.25 tsp).

Street Corn Variation: For 'with cheese' version, stir in crumbled cotija/feta cheese (1.5 tbsp per serving). For 'without cheese', omit the cheese. Stir in chopped fresh cilantro to taste for either version.
Grill/Char Jalapeños: Grill or pan-sear sliced jalapeños (0.5 per serving) until softened and lightly charred.
Assemble Bowls: Layer Mexican rice in the bottom of each bowl. Top with cooked protein, street corn mixture, and charred jalapeño slices.
cookNotes: Recipe base yield is 1 serving. Scale ingredients accordingly.
Protein can be marinated ahead of time.
Street corn can be made with or without cheese. Cheese listed in main ingredients is for the 'with cheese' version; omit if desired.
Mexican rice uses a 3:1 water-to-rice ratio for a softer texture, as intended.
